definition: variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: After a prolonged siege, the town was rendered up to the insurgents.
sentences.chinese: 经过长时间包围之后，这个小镇已被起义军攻克。

sentences.english: However, social is one area it has yet to master.
sentences.chinese: 不过社交网络仍是网飞尚未攻克的领域。

sentences.english: He mustered up enough courage to attack the difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 他鼓起足够的勇气去攻克难关。

sentences.english: Turkish military forces quickly seized several strategic cities and towns, and then brutally entered Corinth.
sentences.chinese: 土军快速攻克了数个战略重镇，随后进入了科林斯。

sentences.english: Continuous bombing spearheaded the way to occupying the city.
sentences.chinese: 持续不停的轰炸为攻克该城铺平了道路。

sentences.english: Robert charged himself with the task of overcoming a technical difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特承担了攻克技术难关的任务。

sentences.english: No single Ming general want to rebel and Li finally seized Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 没有单一明总想造反，李终于攻克了北京。

sentences.english: I began to see how nature beat this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我开始认识到自然界是如何攻克这个难题的。

sentences.english: The scientist has worried at the problem during the last two months.
sentences.chinese: 科学工作者在过去的两个月里绞尽脑汁攻克难题。

sentences.english: In the overcoming of the flesh, we find life and peace.
sentences.chinese: 若我们攻克己身，叫身服我，我就得著生命与平安。

sentences.english: Without good pronunciation , English is useless and endless.
sentences.chinese: 没有好的发音，英语就毫无用处，永无攻克之日。

sentences.english: The major technical constraints on damming the Yarlung Tsampo have been overcome.
sentences.chinese: 在雅鲁藏布江上修建水坝的技术难题已经被攻克。

sentences.english: That's the mind-boggling question at the heart of a theory scientists say they are on the brink of solving.
sentences.chinese: 这已成为科学家即将攻克的某理论的核心问题。

sentences.english: Team work experience under the passion and happiness.
sentences.chinese: 体验团队共同攻克难关的激情和喜悦。

sentences.english: Not discouraged by barriers; confronts them as challenges to overcome.
sentences.chinese: 不为任何困难和障碍泄气，以面对挑战的心态去攻克。

sentences.english: Modern medical science has conquered many diseases which used to be considered as uncurable.
sentences.chinese: 现代医学攻克了许多曾被认为是绝症的疾病。

definition: to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
to follow up a victory/to pursue retreating enemy
to storm a strategic pass/fig. to tackle a key problem
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
